CodeListDescription: EU Toy Safety Directive hazard warning type

Code.CodeNotes: Use to provide positive indication that no warnings are applicable
Use to specify age (in years, or years and months). Provide specific wording in <ProductFormFeatureDescription>

Code.CodeDescription: Carries EU Toy Safety Directive ‘Unsuitable for children ages 0–3’ warning logo
Code.CodeNotes: Carries logo, and must be accompanied by the default warning ‘Not suitable for children under 36 months’ (or its approved equivalent in a language other than English, as appropriate), unless specific wording is provided in <ProductFormFeatureDescription>. If specific alternative wording is carried in <ProductFormFeatureDescription>, this must be used in place of the default text

Code.CodeDescription: Carries EU Toy Safety Directive hazard warning
Code.CodeNotes: Exact text of warning must be included in <ProductFormFeatureDescription>

Code.CodeDescription: Carries other text associated with toy safety
Code.CodeNotes: Exact text (not in itself a warning) must be included in <ProductFormFeatureDescription>. May be used either without any warning, or as text additional to a warning. Note that if no warnings apply, code 00 can provide positive indication of this. Example uses: ‘Suitable for all ages’ or ‘Adult supervision required’

Material Safety Data Sheet (a document required by the EU Toy Safety Directive) available online, typically as a PDF file or similar. <ProductFormFeatureDescription> must carry the URL of the document
Declaration of Conformity (the document that backs up the CE or CA mark) available online, typically as a PDF file or similar. <ProductFormFeatureDescription> must carry the URL of the document
If specific alternative wording is carried in <ProductFormFeatureDescription>, this must be used in place of the default ‘Conforms to EN71’ text
UK Conformity Assessment mark. Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later
